page.title: 07SOUTHAMPTON COMMON 1
page.content: The Common is situated in the centre of Southampton. It is bounded to the east and west by two major routes running North and South from the city centre to the M27 in the north. The common consists of a large grassy area crossed by a network of paths and dotted with small areas of dense deciduous trees and bushes. There are three lakes, one used for model boats, and a paddling pool. There are facilities for some team games; a playground attracts young children and is used by a playgroup, but the essential use is as a 'lung' for the city. A number of events are staged on the common. The City show, lasting three days in July attracts a large following. There is also a fair for about four days during the spring bank holiday.
